org.jacorb.orb

Interface IBufferManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBufferManager, BufferManager, JDK15NonSyncBufferManager

    public interface IBufferManager
    A BufferManager is used to share a pool of buffers and to implement a buffer allocation policy. This reduces the number of memory allocations and deallocations and the overall memory footprint. Buffers are generally created on demand.
    Author:
    Gerald Brose

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] getBuffer(int size)
      getBuffer returns a new buffer.
      byte[] getExpandedBuffer(int requiredSize)
      getExpandedBuffer returns a new buffer which size will be calculated according to BufferManager expansion policy.
      byte[] getPreferredMemoryBuffer() 
      void release()
      release all resources that are held by this buffer
      void returnBuffer(byte[] buf)
      equals returnBuffer(buffer, false)
      void returnBuffer(byte[] buffer, boolean cdrStr)
